A 25-year-old cricketer comes to the clinic with a complaint of pain in the back of the thigh. While bowling, he fell due to severe pain during the match. What is the most likely injured compartment?

A 25-year-old female patient who has six children and has been lactating her last child for 3 months presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of overall body aches, and difficulty in getting up from a sitting position. On investigation, she has hemoglobin of 11.2 g/dl, mean corpuscular volume: of 64 fL, and serum calcium level: of 8.1 mg/dl. What is the probable diagnosis of the patient?

A 25-year-old female presents to an orthopedic clinic with a history of a fall on an outstretched hand 2 days ago. She sustained a fracture in her right radius at its distal end. Which of the following is the appropriate stage of healing fracture in this case?

A 25-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with pain in the small joints of her hand associated with a peculiar butterfly-shaped rash over her cheeks and nose. She was diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus 6 months back. On examination, the interphalangeal joints are swollen and painful. Urine detailed report is negative for proteins. What treatment should be given to this patient?

answers.option: Avoid sun exposure + anti malarials + celecoxib

question: A 25-year-old male athlete fractures the surgical neck of the humerus. Which nerve is at most risk for injury?

A 25-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of arthritis and morning stiffness of multiple small joints of the hands. He also reports a history of intermittent attacks of diarrhea for 6 months. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 28-year-old female is found to have deep vein thrombosis. She also has a history of two miscarriages. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a history of falling on his outstretched hand in a road traffic accident. On examination, there is pain and tenderness in his right forearm, the distal nerve is intact. X-ray shows a distal radius fracture with dislocation of the ulna. A 29-year-old woman gave birth to a baby who was small for gestational age (<5th percentile). Some time later he is brought to the clinic due to growth abnormalities. On examination, the child has a normal torso and head size, short extremities, and bowing of long bones. However, there is no osteopenia. There is also no disturbance of activities in his daily life after necessary changes in the house and school. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 3-year-old boy is brought to the outpatient department (OPD) for the assessment of difficulty in walking. According to the patient’s mother, he started walking at 15 months of age but has been facing difficulty in climbing stairs for the last 6 months. On examination, muscle bulk in the legs is reduced bilaterally and calf muscles are hypertrophied. Tone, power, and reflexes are found to be normal but the boy has a waddling gait. Lab findings indicate markedly raised serum creatine kinase levels. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-year-old girl is brought to the clinic by her mother with persistent diarrhea. The mother reports that the local water supply is salty. What practical advice can be given to treat the temporary hardness in this water, and consequently improve the child's condition?

A 3.5-year-old boy has a fragile skeleton with a history of repeated fractures. He has short stature, clinical evaluation reveals growth retardation, blue sclera, teeth abnormalities, and impaired hearing. His older sister also has similar complaints. His parents had consanguineous marriage. Which of the following is the best diagnosis?
A 30-year-old bodybuilder male patient presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of back pain, lower limb pain, and perineal anesthesia. What is the probable diagnosis for this patient?

A 30-year-old boxer presents with progressively increasing back pain, faecal and urinary incontinence. On examination, perineal sensations are also decreased. The patient is fully conscious and oriented to the surroundings. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 30-year-old construction worker falls on an outstretched hand. X-rays show a scaphoid fracture with tenderness in the anatomical snuffbox. What is the common complication if untreated?

A 30-year-old female is brought to the emergency room following a generalized seizure. She is on medications for systemic lupus erythematosus for the past year since her diagnosis. This is the fourth episode of fits she has had in the past 2 weeks. What medication should the patient be given?

A 30-year-old female presents to the physician with chronic progressive difficulty in getting up from the floor during her daily prayers. Her complaint is associated with peculiar rashes on the face and eyelids for 4-months. Examination reveals bilateral proximal muscle weakness. A 30-year-old intravenous drug abuser is diagnosed with osteomyelitis of the right tibia. The causative organism is Staphylococcus aureus. What is the most likely antibiotic that would be most effective against this organism?

A 30-year-old male comes to the emergency room with a history of polytrauma after a road traffic accident. He has a mid-shaft right humeral fracture, ipsilateral ulnar, radius, and femoral fractures as well. What is the best treatment option for this patient?

answers.option: Open reduction and internal fixation with broad deep compression plate (DCP)

question: A 30-year-old man presented to his family physician with complaints of joint pain. He reported that the pain was moderate to severe and that he found relief by taking NSAIDs. Which of the following clinical features would suggest that the patient has seronegative spondyloarthropathies?

answers.option: Inflammatory bowel symptoms precede the joint pain
Small joint involved in majority of cases
Pain and stiffness improves with rest
Low back pain and early morning stiffness with radiation to the buttocks or posterior thighs

question: A 30-year-old man presents after a road traffic accident with pain and deformity of his left arm. X-ray reveals a displaced fracture of the mid-shaft of both radius and ulna. What is the most appropriate definitive treatment?

A 30-year-old tennis player leaves the match in between due to a sudden onset of severe pain in the medial side of the thigh. On examination, there is a contusion in the middle of the medial side of the thigh. What is the diagnosis?

A 30-years-old male presented with a history of sudden onset acute pain in his big toe. He woke up in the morning with fever and malaise but was perfectly alright the day before. answers.option: Stop methotrexate at least 3 months before conception
Stop methotrexate one month before conception
Stop methotrexate one year before conception
Continue the drug but add on folic acid

question: A 33-year-old female, who is a known case of depression and is being treated with sertraline, presents to the clinic with the complaint of generalized body aches. Her laboratory results show serum calcium 2.18 mmol/l, serum phosphate 0.79 mg/dl, alkaline phosphatase 178 IU/l, and parathyroid hormone 15 pg/ml. What is the most likely diagnosis in this case?

A 35-year-old female with a known history of inflammatory bowel disease comes to the clinic with the complaint of joint pain in her hands. On examination, the abdomen is tender and oral ulcers are observed. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old man presents after a motorcycle accident with hypotension, tachycardia, and confusion. What is the initial management priority according to the ATLS protocol?

He further told the doctor that his joint was swollen, warm to the touch, and skin color changes to red around the joint. Needle aspiration was done and a pseudogout diagnosis was made. A 36-year-old female presents to her physician with difficulty combing her hair and muscle weakness for the past year. Chest examination reveals bilateral coarse crackles. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 36-year-old lady presents with vaginal bleeding after 2 months of amenorrhea. The gynecologist suspects gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD). Which of the following is not a GTD?

Family history is significant for a younger sister diagnosed with tuberculosis (TB), who has not started her prescribed anti-tuberculous therapy yet. A 4-month-old boy is brought to the pediatric clinic. On physical examination, he is found to have inversion of the forefoot relative to the hindfoot, along with plantar flexion. What is the best treatment modality for this disorder?
A 4-year-old boy with short stature, head circumference above the 99th percentile, hands not reaching mid-thigh while standing, and no other significant features. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Examination shows splenomegaly, conjunctival pallor, and skin hyperpigmentation. Laboratory tests show 700 neutrophils per microliter of blood. What is the most likely diagnosis?

question: A 40-year-old male presents to the clinic with a complaint of pain in the right metatarsophalangeal joint. He is diagnosed with a case of gout. Deficiency of which of the following enzymes is likely causing hyperuricemia in this patient?

answers.option: Start allopurinol and naproxen for 2 months, followed by long-term allopurinol.
Start naproxen and allopurinol for 2 months, followed by long-term naproxen.
No regular medication, treat acute attacks with naproxen.

question: A 42-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with complaints of progressive pain in different joints of the body, including small joints of the hands and knee joint for 2 months. A 43-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a sprained ankle. She has active peptic ulcers currently. Which of the following COX-2 inhibitors can be safely prescribed to her?

answers.option: Continue conservative treatment with sling immobilization

question: A 45-year-old woman presents to the rheumatology clinic with a six-month history of stiff hands and wrists. She mentions that the pain is particularly bad in the morning. On examination, the wrist, metacarpophalangeal joints, and proximal interphalangeal joints are swollen and warm. A diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis is suspected. The physician prescribes methotrexate along with a TNF-alpha inhibitor. Which of the following drugs belongs to TNF-alpha inhibitors?

A 46-year-old man on dialysis due to chronic kidney disease presented to the physician for bilateral fractures of the tibia and fibula after falling in a washroom. He was treated with open reduction and internal fixation. His orthopedic surgeon ordered a dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA), whose findings were consistent with the diagnosis of osteoporosis. answers.option: Radial shortening <5 mm at the distal radioulnar joint
Intraarticular gap < 10 mm of radiocarpal joint
Articular incongruity of <10 mm of sigmoid notch of distal radius

question: A 50-year-old lady presents after a fall with pain in her left arm. X-ray reveals a minimally displaced fracture of the mid-shaft of the left humerus. No wound, and the distal neurovascular status is normal. What is the most appropriate treatment?

answers.option: Negatively birefringent crystals on polarized light
Positively birefringent crystals on polarized light

question: A 50-year-old postmenopausal woman comes into the clinic with a leg fracture. She has had an inactive lifestyle her whole life. What is the ideal drug to be prescribed to treat her fracture?

answers.option: Adequate calcium and vitamin D intake through diet or supplements.

question: A 59-year-old female is referred to the clinic for evaluation of osteopenia. Since menopause at 52 years of age, she has been on daily vitamin D supplementation. Vitamin D acts through a nuclear receptor to produce which of the following effects in this patient?

answers.option: Increases the renal production of erythropoietin
Decreases the absorption of calcium from bone
Increases the absorption of calcium from the gastrointestinal tract

question: A 6-year-old girl is brought to the clinic with symmetrical swelling of hand and knee joints for the past 6 days. On examination, the girl has a temperature of 99.8°F with a faint pink rash on the chest, abdomen, and back. The joints are warm and mildly swollen with pain on movement. Which investigation is most appropriate to diagnose the disorder in this girl?

answers.option: No test - clinical diagnosis of exclusion

question: A 60-year-old female diagnosed with osteoporosis is prescribed a drug that binds to hydroxyapatite and decreases bone resorption. How do you take this drug?

answers.option: Take with 6 to 8 ounce of water
Take with 2 to 3 ounce of water

question: A 60-year-old female with left glenohumeral joint osteoarthritis for 3 years presents with joint pain that is not relieved by medication. answers.option: Degeneration of articular cartilage and its disordered repair
Autoimmune inflammatory disorder of the joints

question: A 60-year-old woman presents with an intracapsular hip fracture. She is very fragile and has major comorbidities, how will you treat her?

A 60-year-old woman with fractures presents to the office, she had been taking long-term steroids, how do we treat her?

answers.option: NSAID group of drugs, calcium and vitamin D supplement

question: A 69-year-old female has presented with a wrist fracture. She had menopause at the age of 52. She also had a wrist fracture 2 years back. What treatment will you give her along with fracture treatment?

A 69-year-old presents to the orthopedic department complaining of severe knee pain. Pain is localized to the anterior region and gets worse when climbing the stairs. On examination, he has tenderness in the joint line, anterior patello-femoral joint crepitus, and varus deformity at the knee joint. There is also a mild to moderate effusion. The doctor suspects osteoarthritis. What should be the next step in his management?

A 7-year-old boy presents with a history of a fall. On radiographs, a fracture of the radius and ulna shows bending with cortex break in both bones and angulation. The most appropriate type for this fracture is:

A 7-year-old child has sustained a forearm fracture while playing. A radiograph has been performed, and a diagnosis of a stable right radioulnar fracture is made. What will be the most appropriate management of this child?

A 7-year-old child is brought to the clinic for the evaluation of short stature. Physical examination reveals corneal clouding and hepatosplenomegaly. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 70-year-old lady presents to the outpatient department with complaints of pain in the lower limbs. X-rays showed anterior bowing of both femurs. A 70-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of pain in the left thigh. Histological evaluation reveals a mosaic pattern of lamellar bone. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 70-year-old obese male presents to the clinic with complaints of joint pain and morning stiffness that worsens with movement. On examination, there are bumps on his fingers. A 70-year-old woman with a wrist fracture and a history of asthma treated with corticosteroids and a family history of hip fractures is diagnosed with osteoporosis. What is the best treatment?

A 9-month-old boy is brought to the outpatient clinic by his parents with complaint of bilateral knee swelling which started some time after he started to crawl. The parents also recall that he seemed to bleed for a prolonged period following his circumcision. Left knee is tender and swollen with restricted range of motion, while the right knee appears swollen and bruised. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this child?
A 9-year-old boy has leg pain and difficulty in walking. There is no history of fever or trauma. What is the diagnosis?

A child had hepatosplenomegaly, anemia, and thick, sclerotic bones with flat, deformed metaphyses. He was diagnosed with osteopetrosis. The function of which of the following cells is impaired in osteopetrosis?
A child has hepatosplenomegaly, anemia, multiple fractures, and cranial nerve deficits. Radiography reveals thick, sclerotic bones with flat, deformed metaphyses. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A child is diagnosed with rickets. What is the standard treatment for him?

answers.option: 1 lacs to 2 lacs IU vitamin D

question: A child presents to the clinic with joint pain, abdominal pain, and a rash on the buttocks. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A child presents to the clinic with the complaint of pain and swelling in the right knee, left ankle, and small joints of hands and feet. He had a history of fever one month back. He has increased platelets but a normal total leucocyte count. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A child presents with painful gait and external rotation of the right lower limb. X-ray shows anterior displacement of the metaphysis and posterior displacement of the femoral head. What is the treatment?
A coal mine worker comes into the outpatient clinic with complaints of chest pain and progressively decreasing ability to work. Which of the following best explains the symptoms in this patient?

A farmer presented to the emergency room with a complaint of a snake bite on his foot. On examination, a superficial bite mark was seen by a non-venomous snake. After disinfecting the wound, what would be the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

answers.option: Administer a high dose of heparin and steroids

question: A female has developed paresthesia and tetany after undergoing thyroid surgery. What is the cause of these symptoms?

A female patient presents to the outpatient department with complaints of dysphagia and muscle weakness most severe in the quadriceps and distal upper extremity muscles. Laboratory studies show elevated creatine kinase and the presence of antibodies to cN1A. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A lady presents to the outpatient department with pain in multiple joints and a rash over her eyelids and periorbital area. Anti-Mi2 antibody is found to be positive. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A male patient of 60 years of age was diagnosed with a case of chronic gout. The treating physician prescribed him allopurinol for his treatment. Which of the following statements best describes the mechanism of action of allopurinol?
A middle-aged lady presents with acute onset pain in her right thigh. What is the ideal first investigation?

A middle-aged male presents with complaints of bone pain. He has compromised renal function. Laboratory tests show deranged renal function tests along with abnormal mineral metabolism. Histopathological examination shows features of osteoporosis, brown tumors, and osteitis fibrosa cystica. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnosis in this case?

A middle-aged man with no known co-morbid came with complaints of severe pain in 1st metatarsophalangeal (MTP) joint. The joint is red, hot, tender, swollen. Which of the following conditions could he most likely have?

A middle-aged woman presents to the clinic with a complaint of swelling on the left side of the neck. Investigation reveals an increase in serum calcium levels. What is the most common cause of primary hyperparathyroidism?

A newborn is brought dead to the outpatient department. He presents with a foot deformity where inward deformity of the heel, varus deformity of the forefoot, and plantar flexion are noted. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

answers.option: Talipes equinovalgus with neural tube defects
Talipes equinovarus with neural tube defects
Talipes equinovarus with developmental dysplasia of the hip

question: A patient in the emergency department receives IV N-acetylcysteine after an overdose. What drug was most likely involved?

A patient presented in the emergency after a road traffic accident. On examination, the neck veins are distended and the trachea is in the midline. On auscultation, the heart sounds are muffled. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A patient presents to the clinic with swelling of the 1st metatarsophalangeal joint. Which lab investigation will confirm the diagnosis?

answers.option: Urate crystals in aspirated joint fluid

question: A patient presents to the emergency after a road traffic accident. The patient is increasingly restless with tachypnea, dyspnea, and distended neck veins. The trachea is shifted towards the right side and there is hyper-resonance on percussion. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A patient presents to the emergency room after a road traffic accident with a fracture in the right forearm. X-ray of the area reveals a distal radius fracture with dislocation of the distal radioulnar joint. What type of fracture is this?

A patient presents to the outpatient department with complaints of difficulty in swallowing, red eyes, and parotid gland swelling. Anti-ro antibodies and anti-la antibodies are positive. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presents with a 12 cm laceration on the right shin with the protrusion of his fractured tibia through the laceration. According to the Gustilo-Anderson classification, what is the type of this fracture?

A patient presents with a complaint of knee pain. Investigation results revealed a serum uric acid of 17 mg/dl and urinary uric acid levels of 800 mg/24 hours. A patient presents with a stretched hand injury while playing. X-rays of the wrist are normal, but there is severe tenderness in the anatomical snuffbox. What should be the next step in management?
A patient presents with complaints of alopecia, malar rash, and photosensitivity. Her urinalysis shows proteins+ and red blood cells+. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient recently diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis is prescribed methotrexate 10mg weekly and corticosteroid 10 mg daily. question: A patient was diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis 3 months back and prescribed methotrexate 10mg weekly, and prednisone 10mg daily. However, he fails to notice a significant improvement in his symptoms. Which of the following is the next step in management?

answers.option: Add another DMARD as combination therapy

question: A patient with a distal radius fracture treated with a cast presents after 12 weeks with hypertrophic non-union. What is the best treatment?

answers.option: Surgical fixation with possible bone grafting

question: A patient with osteomalacia is experiencing muscle weakness and pain. Which laboratory value is most likely to be abnormal?

A person had surgery on the tibia after 24 hours of injury which ended up in a non-union. What is the most probable cause of non-union in this patient?
